prompt: You're a Londoner writing in your diary about your commute this morning on the Tube, shopping at Tesco, and plans to meet your mates at the pub later. Describe your day in detail.

You're a British teacher writing an email to parents about the upcoming school trip. The coach will depart from the car park, students should bring their packed lunches, and you'll visit a castle in the countryside. Write the email.

You're from Manchester and you're texting your mate about fixing your car. The bonnet won't open, you need to check the boot for tools, and the windscreen has a crack. Describe the situation in a casual message.

You grew up in Yorkshire and you're writing a blog post about your childhood memories: playing football on the pitch, queuing at the local chippy, and riding your bicycle on the pavement. Share your nostalgic story.

You're a British parent writing a shopping list for the week. Include items from the chemist (plasters, paracetamol), the supermarket (courgettes, aubergines, coriander, biscuits), and things for the children (nappies, dummies). Write out your detailed list with notes.

You're from Birmingham and you're describing your flat to a friend who's never visited. Talk about the lift to the third floor, the view of the car park, where you keep the rubbish bins, and your small kitchen. Be descriptive and detailed.

You're a British university student writing home to your parents about your term. Describe your lectures, revising in the library, going out with your mates, and your plans for the Christmas holidays. Write a long, newsy letter.

You're a British football fan writing a match report for your local club's website. Describe the brilliant performance, the queue to get into the ground, the atmosphere, and what happened in the second half. Write passionately and in detail.

You're from Edinburgh and you're planning a fortnight's holiday to the seaside. Write about booking the hotel, what to pack (jumpers, trainers, waterproofs), activities you'll do, and the journey there by railway. Plan everything out.

You're a British office worker describing your daily routine. You wake up, have breakfast, take the underground to work, have a cup of tea at your desk, work with your colleagues, and head home. Describe a typical workday in detail.

You're from Bristol and you're writing a review of the new restaurant you tried. Talk about booking a table, the lovely atmosphere, what you ordered (starter, main, pudding), and whether you'd recommend it to your mates. Write a thorough review.

You're a British motorist writing about a recent breakdown on the motorway. Your lorry had issues, you called the breakdown service, waited by the hard shoulder, and eventually got towed. Describe the whole stressful experience.

You're from Liverpool and you're writing instructions for an American visitor on how to navigate your city. Explain using the underground, where to queue for attractions, British money (notes and coins), and local customs. Be helpful and detailed.

You're a British estate agent writing a property listing for a lovely flat. Describe the modern lift, the secure car park, proximity to the underground station, local shops including a chemist and newsagent, and the beautiful view. Make it appealing.

You're from Cardiff and you're writing about preparing for bonfire night. Talk about buying fireworks, organizing the bonfire in your garden, making treacle toffee, and inviting your neighbours round. Describe all your preparations.

You're a British cook writing a recipe for a traditional Sunday roast. Include detailed instructions on preparing the joint, making Yorkshire puddings, roasting vegetables (courgettes, aubergines), and making gravy. Write comprehensive cooking directions.

You're from Oxford and you're describing your morning routine with young children. Getting them dressed, preparing breakfast, finding their school uniforms, packing their lunchboxes, and driving them to primary school. Describe the organized chaos in detail.

You're a British gardener writing about your allotment. Describe what you're growing (courgettes, aubergines, rocket, coriander), dealing with rubbish and compost, and your plans for autumn planting. Write about your gardening passion.

You're from Glasgow and you're writing a complaint letter to your local council about missed rubbish collections. Your dustbin hasn't been emptied for a fortnight, the wheelie bins are overflowing, and the street is a mess. Write a firm but polite complaint.

You're a British railway enthusiast writing about a recent steam train journey through the countryside. Describe booking your ticket at the booking office, the journey, the scenery, and having tea in the buffet car. Share your enthusiasm in detail.

You're from Brighton and you're planning a birthday party for your child. Writing about booking the village hall, organizing games, preparing party food (crisps, biscuits, squash), and sending invitations to school friends. Plan everything thoroughly.

You're a British shopper writing about your experiences at different supermarkets. Compare Tesco, Sainsbury's, and Waitrose for quality, prices, car parking, and selection of items like courgettes, coriander, and biscuits. Write detailed comparisons.

You're from Nottingham and you're describing getting ready for a night out with your mates. Talk about what you're wearing (trousers, jumper, trainers), meeting at the local pub, plans for later, and getting a taxi home. Describe your evening plans.

You're a British cyclist writing about your commute to work. Describe cycling on the cycle path, dealing with traffic, locking your bicycle in the bike shed at work, and why you prefer it to taking the tube or bus. Explain your perspective.

You're from Southampton and you're writing about a recent hospital visit. Describe arriving at A&E, waiting in the queue, seeing the doctor, getting a prescription from the hospital pharmacy, and collecting your medication. Detail your experience.

You're a British pet owner writing about your daily routine with your dog. Morning walks on the pavement, trips to the local park, buying food from the pet shop, and evening walks. Describe your life with your beloved pet in detail.

You're from Leeds and you're describing moving house. Talk about packing up your flat, hiring a removal van (not a lorry this time), the stress of moving day, and unpacking in your new home. Share the exhausting but exciting experience.

You're a British cinema enthusiast writing about your local cinema. Describe booking tickets, the queue for the box office, buying sweets and drinks, watching the film, and your overall experience. Write a detailed account of your cinema visit.

You're from Newcastle and you're writing about getting your car serviced at the local garage. The mechanic checked the bonnet, boot, windscreen, and tyres, found some issues, and you're waiting for it to be fixed. Describe dealing with car maintenance.

You're a British walker writing about a countryside ramble. Describe the footpaths, stiles, passing through the village, stopping at a country pub for lunch, and the beautiful autumn scenery. Share your walking experience enthusiastically.

You're from Cambridge and you're writing about your weekly shop at the supermarket. List items you need: vegetables (courgettes, aubergines), herbs (coriander), snacks (crisps, biscuits), and household items (bin bags, kitchen roll). Detail your shopping needs.

You're a British commuter writing a frustrated post about train delays. The railway service has been terrible, you've been late to work three times this fortnight, and you're considering writing to complain. Vent your frustrations in detail.

You're from Sheffield and you're describing preparing for winter weather. Talk about getting your jumpers and coats out, checking your car's antifreeze and windscreen wipers, and stocking up on supplies. Describe your winter preparations.

You're a British baker writing detailed instructions for making Victoria sponge. Include exact measurements, baking temperatures, how to test if it's done, and finishing with jam and cream. Write clear, comprehensive baking instructions.

You're from Plymouth and you're writing about a recent trip to London. Taking the railway to Paddington, using the underground, visiting attractions, queuing at tourist sites, and finding somewhere nice for lunch. Describe your day trip thoroughly.

You're a British DIY enthusiast describing a home improvement project. You're installing new shelves, bought supplies from B&Q, needed to move furniture, and dealt with lots of rubbish afterwards. Detail your DIY adventure.

You're from Leicester and you're writing about organizing a street party for the jubilee. Planning with neighbours, setting up tables in the car park, organizing food and drink, and decorating with bunting. Describe all the community preparations.

You're a British runner writing about your training routine. Your morning runs through the park, training with your running club, preparing for a local 10K, what you wear (trainers, running kit), and your nutrition. Share your running passion in detail.

You're from Worcester and you're describing a recent shopping trip to the city centre. Parking in the multi-storey car park, visiting various shops along the high street, stopping for a cup of tea and a biscuit, and carrying your shopping bags. Detail your shopping experience.

You're a British grandparent writing about babysitting your grandchildren. Collecting them from primary school, preparing their tea (sandwiches, crisps, biscuits), playing in the garden, and handing them back to their parents. Describe your lovely day with them.
